page.title: 04 The Tithe Barn.
page.content: The tithe barn at Batts farm has one large door for a loaded wagon to go in and one small door for the wagon to go out when it's unloaded.The tithe barn's floor is 5.2 metres wide and the solid oak beams in the roof are 5.4 metres because they have to fit into the side of the walls.It has small slit windows like a castle and two larger ones,all for air conditioning.The tithe barn has quite thick walls. In medieval times tithe payments were paid once a year and you paid the church, bishops and priests one tenth of your produce or animals for the year. Later on tithes were paid in money. The barn, despite its age still seems to be in good condition.We hope,that in the future the barn will not be knocked down.
